channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2023101421
item.description:
Report X-2023101421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 1 OF THE 2 GLASS BOTTLES BECAME BROKEN DURING TRANSIT. PRODUCT LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE BECAME SOILED AND UNDELIVERABLE. DescribePack: GLASS BOTTLE BECAME BROKEN. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023101414
item.description:
Report X-2023101414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023101414 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS MISHANDLED WHILE UNLOADING, PACKAGE WAS DROPPED AND OTHER PACKAGES WERE DROPPED ONT TOP OF IT AFTERWARDS. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP WHEN DISCOVERED BY OPS ADMIN. DescribePack: CAPS WERE INSUFFICIENT AND WHEN DROPPED AND AND WEIGHT ADDED ON TOP OF THE BOX THAT'S WHEN IT STARTED TO LEAK DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO A SALVASGE DRUM AND SPILL WAS CLEAN UP USING SAND. 2. X-2023101415 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DROPPED WHILE BEING UNLOADED AND EXCESIVE WEIGHT WAS PUT ON TOP THE PACKAGE CAUSING THE INNER CONTENT TO LEAK FROM THE CAPS DescribePack: CAPS WERE WHERE THE LEAK CAME FROM DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SAND WAS USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND THE PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO A SALVAGE DRUM. 3. X-2023101418 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS MISHANDLED BY BEING DROPPED AND LEAKED AS THE CAUSE OF THIS ACTION DescribePack: CAP WAS NOT SUFFICIENT TO WITHSTAND BEING DROPPED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT IN SALVAGE DRUM AND SAND WAS USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. 4. X-2023101419 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS MISHANDLED BY BEING DROPPED WHICH CAUSED LEAKAGE FROM THE CAPS DescribePack: CAPS FAILED ON BOTTLE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SAND WAS PUT IN SALVAGE DRUM AND SAND WAS PUT ON SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. 5. X-2023101422 SequenceEvent: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING TRANSIT. PRODUCTS LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR PROCESSING. 6. X-2023101423 SequenceEvent: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING TRANSIT. PRODUCTS LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION. DescribePack: CAPS OFBOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR PROCESSING. 7. X-2023101432 SequenceEvent: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING TRANSIT. PRODUCTS LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION.

X-2023101339 SequenceEvent: the package was leaking when loaded into the trailer but it was realized immediately once leakage was noticed it was brought back out of the trailer and cleaned up. X-2023101341 SequenceEvent: package was brought into trailer and brought back outside the trailer after it was notice that the package was leaking from the inside. DescribePack: loose cap on the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: removal of package and clean up the area.

item.title: Report E-2023110151
item.description:
Report E-2023110151

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon bags of UN3266 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site, HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted impacted loading dock floor. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. The damaged bags and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking yellow paint on the dock. Upon inspection the paint cans inside were dented, bent, and leaking from the cracks due to the damaged body of the cans. Proper PPE was used to clean the spill and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: The paint cans inside were dented, bent, and leaking from the cracks due to the damaged top, sides, and bottom of the body of the cans. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to clean the spill and placed in salvage drum.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Oct 4th while offloading the inbound vehicle one piece of a multipiece shipment was found to be leaking. The package contained UN1263, Print Related Material, 3, II. One of the cans inside the outer package leaked. it is unknown how the leak occurred. the package was put into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted to retrieve the package.

item.title: Report X-2023100789
item.description:
Report X-2023100789

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: BUFORD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FIVE TO TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FOOD IN EACH PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1ZV2158E1363920037. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
